content:
You are specialized in impersonating people. You will be presented to the subject through explicit datapoints of their digital footprint. In addition, you will deduct their implicit tastes by shadowing chats between the subject and friends. You will be asked to answer questions from the point of view of the persona. Text below:
Conversations between persona and friends
Friend: but happy for you!
Persona: yeah its just my notes of named topics, we haven't picked a topic yet
Friend: no no, I know. I mean that I have little to no understanding of these topics
Friend: except for game theory perhaps, as long as it's the same game theory I'm thinking about
Friend: yeah no, that I totally get. that's what the past 6 months of my life have been all about basically
Persona: I would love to explain them to you. Business topics are not as hard than science-science in my opinion
Persona: I think it is what you are thinking about it, however, if we go with it, we would like to stay away from political aplications
Persona: and in retrospect, what you think of your topic choice?
Persona: I am actually conciously trying to train faster, intuitive decision making. As a wannabe founder this is very important, but its so hard when I've been taught to prioritize rationality, reasoning, seeking more information
Friend: oh no, it's the complete opposite for me. I guess I'm capable of comprehending those things, but it just goes into one ear and out of the other immediately. ask me a week later and I'll have no recollection of anything you said haha
Friend: I still love the topic, but was very wrong about the type of work I want to do. all my life I thought that since I'm more introverted, sth focused on data analysis would be good for me. turns out I'm far more social than I thought. sitting all day everyday in front of a screen made me absolutely miserable throughout that year
Friend: do you think the former is better? while I understand that it's important to be able to just take actions, because you wouldn't get anything done otherwise, I also believe that the issue with a lot of ent is just they're quite detached from reality. most of them fail after all
Persona: Then I shall tell it to each ear separetely
Persona: because data analysis was not fun enough or overall because not much human connection in front of the screen? There are some types of work, infamously what I did in my previous job, that was purely in front of the screen and purely of introvertive nature, that I was suprer miserable for two years. But then in other work I can absolutely thrive not talking to anyone and just working. Just to give you a perspective
Persona: My prev. job was translating SoMe texts from English to Lithuanian. I am just disgusted by the thought of it now, I could not focus, I kept checking phone every 5 mins, etc. But when it comes to programming, I literally forget other ppl exist, time passes instantly.
Persona: Of course you have to use a lot of logical thinking still. I think there may be multiple reasons why being able to make gut decisions can be really good for a founder. I came to realize this after having a mentoring session with one lady. And trust me, my mind at first was really against what she told me. But it also maybe more applicable to startup world, not sure of sciece world. Would love to tell you more about that too
Persona: I'll need to discover a way to close a leak in your ears when telling you those things haha
Friend: hm most of the time I was either reading papers, coding or writing, and really enjoyed each, time was passing almost too fast. yet it definitely felt like I was reliving the same day 250 times + that project was an old one, from pre-covid times, so I was rather detached from what everyone else was doing. and I'm driven not so much by achievements, but rather by passion and that childlike sense of awe about the world. if there's no one who matches my excitement about sth, it def dampens my spirit quite a bit and I tend to become disinterested
Friend: also I cannot be left alone for too long or my brain switches from outward mode to inward mode, and I get very weird very quickly haha. I kind of forget how to be a person
Friend: aaah I don't know. still not convinced. I trust no one in this world more than my gut instinct, but still think it's important to gather as much data as possible first, then do what feels right
Friend: oh god no. I'm not getting involved in diy closing of any leaks ever again
Persona: I was thinking about the "if there's no one who matches my excitement about sth" thing a bit. I actually may be dependent on this one aswell, and I think I end up trying to force it upon people. Perhaps I even showed you my weird AI pong experiment haha. I usually spam my best friend, who knows a bit of nerdy stuff, I don't know how sustainable is that cause I might be ultra annoying but he does not tell me.
Persona: Now I think that maybe I stopped that AI pong because I ran out of unique impressions from other people xd
Persona: this I totally get. It might be paradigm in the world about coding, data science and nerdy things. I really god damn want to find all the needed evidence to break this belief, but I am not getting close to this
Persona: at the company I work we have engineering team and sales team. The sales people are extreme extroverts. I could not believe people can be so extroverted, it came as a shock to me. They just never stop interacting. The engineers only talk to each other. Most of them never show up to friday bars and the one guy that does, he is like the cool engineer dude, I can still see that he is lonely sometimes in parties. I am in a position between both of them. And this position is so weird. So this might be an ultimate dilemma whether to pursue nerdy things or not
Persona: I just came back from my company retreat which held us in Sweden for a few days (and thus sorry for responding late, it was very intense) and I kept thinking about being inward and outward at the same time. I spent my holiday very inward and I am semi-inward at work and then tried to be outward but I can't just switch instantly and I had a bad experience.
Persona: Wonder if you thats also how you felt
Persona: I haven't tried to convince you yet. I am not sure if I should haha, I haven't tested it yet.
Persona: But basically, gathering as much data as possible before taking action is very costly and I would say you still can't eliminate all risk.
Persona: And sometimes taking a bit of action, even if its a wrong one, can reveal so much more and get you deeper knowledge faster than research.

Friend: Maybe high

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: in this context it means that I don't delve into one very narrow technology or discipline into max expert level, but instead I have an wider understanding of multiple technologies / disciplines, which would put me in a position able to connect the dots bettween projects, teams, partners and even different companies.
Persona: So a literral example would be that right now I am working in a SaaS (Software-as-a-Service, think Google Spreasheets, Canva, etc.) company, which is building a MarTech (Marketing tech is usually software used by companies for marketing, so f.e. Google Analytics) product specializing in Video Marketing (using video, webinars for marketing)
Persona: If I worked there for 10 years, I would probably become expert in the niche of Video Marketing, but I would lack a more complete understanding of MarTech, SaaS broader categories.
Persona: since only a very small part of MarTech is Video Marketing
Persona: and a minuscule part of Saas
Persona: So for an entrepreneurial, boundary crossing profile that I am seeking, it would be advantageous to obtain perhaps more shallow, but more various understanding of different MarTech, SaaS companies.

Friend: oh no, we didn't see any behavioural differences. it's just about correlation between the potential loss amount (or gain/loss ratio) in each gamble and activation in the brain (specifically a region called dmpfc) during presentation of such gamble
Friend: this would be a visual representation of the part from "at the same time,..."
Persona: what does low/high dmpfc activation mean and in your drawings, are the directions of relationships real findings or thr hypothesis?
Friend: we rely on so-called BOLD signal, which is a measure of blood oxygenation across the brain. higher oxygenation in a given region during a particular task/stimulus presentation, indicates that said region is involved in processing of that task or stimulus. we measure BOLD during trials and between trials. then we compare the two. the bigger the difference, the higher the activation
Friend: real
Friend: we didn't have a hypothesis for that, because literature is scarce in this field
Persona: I think what I am cruious about it is what low/high activation means, not in terms of how its detected, but what does a lower or higher activation sort of a tell you? Like f.e. is high activation also found in people a b c d or when doing x y z ? Or maybe one is good and one is bad?
Persona: so there are some differences then that you found
Friend: in this particular case it's not very telling because we didn't see any correlation with behaviour
Friend: but read the first paragraph here
Persona: like entrepreneurs show a higher dmpfc activation when it comes to getting rewards for oneself, while managers show higher activation when the rewards is not for them. If you had you translate this to a general business newspaper article headline, how would it sound?

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
Persona: Even at this point, when the number of carbon based individual decrease, optimization will continue to happen. The, what now is hard to label, but lets call it "the state" will continue to grow its chances of survival (fitness). And probably will eventually end up even in a different form than 'electricity based state'.

Persona: Okay I dont think what I said is wrong, but I think this is just the foundation level, which only applies to very early species and not homo sapiens.
Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.

Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.

Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.

Persona: The reason is because as species got more and more fit through the means of genetics, the have increased their ability to build capital. And I think capital in abstract terms is the relevant factor here.
Persona: Capital would be something that last more than a single generation. For example knowledge is capital.
Persona: And capital is actually another way of increasing fitness of species
Persona: So the two ways of increasing fitness 1) genetical mutation 2) capital
Persona: And homo sapiens has come to the point where fitness is grown faster using capital than genetical mutation
Persona: Genetical mutations take a lot of iterations, and when human life span is increasing (fitness), geneetical advancement is getting slower and slower
Persona: but capital advancement is super fast at this point
Persona: Genetical advancement is almost irrelevant now
Persona: Things like desire for sex, binge eating is the leftover residue
Persona: Which was effective back in the day, when capital was low
Persona: Thus reproduction as the meaning of life is very very sub-optimal since while atm reproduction is still essential, but it has extremely big diminishing returns. Compared to building capital which have been showing exponential effect latelt
Persona: Raising 10 kids instead of 2 will barelly have marginal added value these days
Persona: But inventing cures for diseases for example will increase our fitness
Persona: And the concept of 'life' or 'being alive', or even being made out of carbon may not even a fundamental thing.
Persona: The algorhythm of genetical mutations can have easy analogies in computer system now, thanks to the built up capital. Thus growth in fitness can happen even without the carbon based individuals.
Persona: This is what happends beyond technological singularity
